sentences.sContent: The figures may not be exactly right, but they’re close enough.
sentences.sCn: 那些数字可能不是非常精确，但也相当接近。

sentences.sContent: ...he discovered that less than 10% of their supposed members agreed on who exactly was on the team...
...Successful team leaders know exactly where the team should go and are able to take prompt action...
...he quotes Google co-founder Larry Page to the effect that the perfect search engine will understand exactly what I mean and give me back exactly what I want...
...The most difficult step in programming values will be deciding exactly what we believe in moral...
...But what exactly needs to be changed...
...they dream of their instructor returning it to them in exactly the same condition...
...It's not clear exactly what skills are most needed or if they will even be valuable in a decade...
...That’s exactly what happened to the subjects who were learning the finger maze...
...What exactly is it that interests you about the job...
...I’ve been working abroad.M: Where exactly have you been working...

synos.tran: 恰好地；正是；精确地；正确地

trans.tranOther: used when emphasizing that something is no more and no less than a number or amount, or is completely correct in every detail
